channel.title: Error Updating Whonix
channel.description:
sudo apt update Ign:1 tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian bullseye-fasttrack InRelease Hit:2 tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian bullseye InRelease Hit:3 tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian bullseye-updates InRelease Hit:4 tor+https://deb.kicksecure.com bullseye InRelease Err:5 tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian bullseye-fasttrack Release SOCKS proxy socks5h://127.0.0.1:9050 could not connect to fasttrack.debian.net (0.0.0.0:0) due to: general SOCKS server failure (1) [IP: 127.0.0.1 9050] Hit:6 tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian-security bullseye-security InRelease Hit:7 tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian bullseye-backports InRelease Hit:8 tor+https://deb.whonix.org bullseye InRelease Reading package lists... Done E: The repository 'tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian bullseye-fasttrack Release' no longer has a Release file. N: Updating from such a repository can't be done securely, and is therefore disabled by default. N: See apt-secure(8) manpage for repository creation and user configuration details.
Software: Ubuntu 22.04 VirtualBox Version 6.1.38_Ubuntu r153438 + Whonix (XFCE-16.0.5.3)
(Started using i2p 2 days ago. Don't know if it as any implications...?)
How can I solve this error? (And should I solve it? - could be an outage or security measure)

item.title: Error Updating Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
update issue - fasttrack: 500 SSL error: wrong version number / unexpected TLS packet - again News
issue: Err:4 http://HTTPS///fasttrack.debian.net/debian bullseye-fasttrack InRelease 500 SSL error: wrong version number [IP: 127.0.0.1 3142] workaround here: https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Operating_System_Software_and_Updates#fasttrack_500_SSL_error:_wrong_version_number (Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

Read full topic

item.title: Error Updating Whonix
item.dc:creator: romina121
item.description:
sudo apt update
Ign:1 tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian bullseye-fasttrack InRelease
Hit:2 tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian bullseye InRelease
Hit:3 tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian bullseye-updates InRelease
Hit:4 tor+https://deb.kicksecure.com bullseye InRelease
Err:5 tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian bullseye-fasttrack Release
SOCKS proxy socks5h://127.0.0.1:9050 could not connect to fasttrack.debian.net (0.0.0.0:0) due to: general SOCKS server failure (1) [IP: 127.0.0.1 9050]
Hit:6 tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian-security bullseye-security InRelease
Hit:7 tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian bullseye-backports InRelease
Hit:8 tor+https://deb.whonix.org bullseye InRelease
Reading package lists… Done
E: The repository ‘tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian bullseye-fasttrack Release’ no longer has a Release file.
N: Updating from such a repository can’t be done securely, and is therefore disabled by default.
N: See apt-secure(8) manpage for repository creation and user configuration details.

Software:
Ubuntu 22.04
VirtualBox Version 6.1.38_Ubuntu r153438 + Whonix (XFCE-16.0.5.3)

(Started using i2p 2 days ago. Don’t know if it as any implications…?)

How can I solve this error? (And should I solve it? - could be an outage or security measure)

Read full topic
